medical_history.chief_complaint: Paraumbilical abdominal pain that migrated to the right lower quadrant.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Patient woke up with sharp, stabbing abdominal pain, which began paraumbilically. After 2 hours, the pain migrated to the right lower quadrant (RLQ). Associated symptoms included nausea, but there was no vomiting or fever.
